- Let \( n \) be the original number of people in the group.

- Then, the total sum of their ages is \( 30n \) because average = sum / n.

Now, one person aged 60 leaves the group. So, the new sum of ages will be the original sum minus 60, which is \( 30n - 60 \).

The new number of people in the group is \( n - 1 \).

Therefore, the new average age should be the new sum divided by the new number of people, which is \( \frac{30n - 60}{n - 1} \).
